Data: Cummins to Bairstow, 1 run fullish and worked away off the legs for one
Cummins to Root, 1 wide short ball, cross-seamer but it's down the leg side, Cummins appeals as Root pulls at it... but Fry immediately signals wide
Cummins to Root, no run good length outside off, Root shoulders arms coming across
Cummins to Root, 1 run pitched up, 142kph and Root drives, eased past cover but mid-off does well to cut it off on the dive
Cummins to Bairstow, no run angled in and turned short towards midwicket
Cummins to Bairstow, 1 run slower delivery, maybe a cutter from Cummins and Bairstow watches it on to the bat and works square
Cummins to Root, no run comes across on off and defends
Stoinis to Bairstow, no run length ball, 130kph outside off but it stays a bit low as YJB swats at it and misses
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run short and wide and rasped on the cut, Smith was pretty close at backward point but gets a good hand on it and keeps them to one
Stoinis to Root, 3 runs length, driven on the up and that's all business from Root, timed through the covers and Warner has to pump the gas to catch up with the ball just in front of the rope
Stoinis to Bairstow, no run pitched up and pushed into the off side

Stoinis to Bairstow, 2 runs dug in short, Bairstow rattles a pull through backward square, Cummins again surfs the wave along the boundary and one-hands it back in for deep square to field. [Jazz voice] Nice
Stoinis to Bairstow, no run length in the channel, dabbed down behind square
Zampa to Root, 1 run loops up the legbreak from over the wicket, pitching middle and leg, eased down the ground to long-on
Zampa to Bairstow, 1 run full outside off, Bairstow swipes a drive out to the cover sweeper
Zampa to Root, 1 run floated up and punched through the off side as he reaches out for it
Zampa to Bairstow, no run rolls his arm over, full outside off and driven into the ground, Paine appeals for the caught-and-bowled - but that was clearly a bump ball
Zampa to Bairstow, 1 run pushed through outside off, punched past cover again
Zampa to Root, 1 run looped up full, Root plays straight and tickles one more down the ground to long-off
Stoinis to Root, 1 run angled in and worked away through square leg for one
Stoinis to Bairstow, no run length, outside off, pushed back to the bowler
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run full, 133kph outside off, Bairstow crunches a drive to the cover sweeper
Stoinis to Root, no run attacking the stumps, Root can only nudge to midwicket
Stoinis to Root, no run trundles in, wicket-to-wicket stuff and again the batsman works to the man at midwicket
Stoinis to Root, 2 runs fullish, uses the feet and dabs a drive through point, into an unguarded part of the field and they hurry back for two
Zampa to Bairstow, no run tossed up and straightening outside off, defended on the back foot
Zampa to Bairstow, no run pushed through and YJB dabs a drive to cover
Zampa to Bairstow, 1 run dragged down a little and this is played square off the back foot for one through point
Zampa to Root, 1 run looped up, Root is down early to reverse-paddle one past short third man, Warner scampers after it to keep them to one
Zampa to Bairstow, no run flighted, Bairstow tries to heave down the ground and completely mistimes it to mid-on
Zampa to Bairstow, 1 run tossed up nice and slow, draws a false shot as YJB reaches out and thick-edges one through backward square leg
Stoinis to Bairstow, no run good length outside off, 131 kph, pushed to cover. Can't seem to force that through extra cover because of that lack of pace
Stoinis to Bairstow, no run nice wicket to wicket bowling, full around off, hit back to the bowler
Stoinis to Bairstow, no run looking to glide that off the open face to third man but the ball came back in - not sure seam movement or an offcutter. Dabbed to point instead. Three dots
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run on the pads this time, 136.5 kph, flicked away to deep square leg
Stoinis to Root, 1 run full and a tad wide, allows Root to stride forward and punch to the sweeper cover for a run
Stoinis to Bairstow, 2 runs there is that dab to third man, gets two actually, fantastic running. On a length outside off, allows the ball to hit the bat, rather than going after it.
Zampa to Root, no run doesn't matter if you're bowling full tosses, Root swats it away to a straight midwicket
Zampa to Root, 1 run nicely bowled, full on middle and leg, some drift in the air, worked away to deep square leg
Zampa to Bairstow, 1 run shortish and wide outside off, carved to deep point.

Zampa to Root, FOUR runs excellent batting, learnt from his error off the first ball, knew midwicket was straight and square leg was wide so when he saw a short ball, he went back and swatted it over where a normal midwicket would have been
Zampa to Root, no run more drift, full and straight, hit back to the bowler
Zampa to Root, 1 run full outside off, carved to the sweeper cover with the full face of the bat.

Marsh to Root, 1 run another good single. Full delivery, moving back in ever so slightly, patted away towards the keeper. Bairstow calls his partner through. Paine's soccer skill isn't the best, by the look of that attempt
Marsh to Bairstow, 3 runs in the air and juuust wide of midwicket. Fullish on middle, Bairstow clips the ball in the air, but just wide of the fielder, to his right
Marsh to Root, 1 run good length outside off, Root comes down and inside-halves the ball into his back thigh. Goes through his legs for a run. Ouch, could have been worse
Marsh to Bairstow, no run full delivery outside off, driven into the cover region
Marsh to Bairstow, no run short and wide outside off, Bairstow nails a cut but finds the impenetrable Steven Smith at backward point, who dives to his right to save two, maybe four
Marsh to Bairstow, no run excellent finish, that's where you want to be on this surface. Full and straight, defended back. A tidy over

Zampa to Root, no run was there some bat? 82 kph, very full outside off, Root shuffles right across and sweeps to short fine leg. Steven Smith speaks to Zampa, who is conversing with Paine. They rightly decide against the review
Zampa to Root, 1 run
Zampa to Bairstow, no run driven into the cover region
Zampa to Bairstow, FOUR runs lovely shot, some flight outside off, so much flight that Bairstow chooses not to move his feet and then lofts the ball neatly over cover. Didn't bother keeping it down

Zampa to Bairstow, OUT oh beautifully bowled. The previous one was the legbreak, this one was the googly. They both were really full, the length allowed Bairstow to throw his hands at the line without his feet. What that did was create a big gap between bat and pad, the legbreak found the middle of the bat, the googly found a massive gap between bat and
Zampa to Morgan, no run another googly, 82 kph, outside off, not much turn, defended back. Excellent length for a wristspinner in that over, rather be full than short for precisely that reason

Starc to Root, no run a full delivery outside off, dabbed towards backward point. Steven Smith picks up and throws at the bowler's end. Hits Morgan's bat, to the angst of the umpire. Could be to scruff up the ball.
Starc to Root, 1 run full and wide outside off, driven elegantly to the sweeper cover

Starc to Morgan, FOUR runs don't think Starc will mind that too much, there is some late inward movement. Full and straight, maybe a tad too straight. Morgan just tickles that fine, to the fine leg boundary
Starc to Morgan, no run 140 kph, wide and full, sliced to the point fielder. Is there some reverse swing? You tend to get reverse quicker on an abrasive surface

Starc to Morgan, no run wow, probably what Australia were playing for, 141 kph outside off, gets the ball to jag back in. It takes the inside edge, hits the back pad and smells the paint of leg stump. An inch straighter and the leg bail would have fallen
Starc to Morgan, 2 runs full and wide outside off, neatly played this time, through cover for a couple. Played inside the line to account for that movement
Zampa to Root, 1 run too much flight, on middle and leg, driven to long-on

Zampa to Morgan, FOUR runs that's how Morgan plays, he backs a very productive shot and connects. Flat and straight, Morgan gets into a really good position and reverse-sweeps through backward point. Out if he missed, but it's a very safe shot for Morgan

Zampa to Morgan, 3 runs did he get some bat? Don't think so, but runs given. Lots of flight outside off, attempts another reverse-sweep but it's too full outside off. Paine is put off by that shot, goes through his legs
Zampa to Root, 1 run some drift on middle and leg, driven to long-on
Zampa to Morgan, no run shortish and wide, 88 kph, wary of the reverse-sweep again, hit to backward point
Zampa to Morgan, no run good end, slow but not full, 89 kph, Morgan gets forward and defends
Starc to Root, 1 run full and wide outside off, carved away to the sweeper cover off the open face. So adept at finding gaps

Starc to Morgan, no run will go down as a drop but those ones either stick or they go through like this. Full and straight, Morgan drives back, can't keep it down. Starc sticks out a right hand, but the ball bursts through. Don't think he got a hand on it actually
Starc to Morgan, no run full and straight again, off the inside half to midwicket
Starc to Morgan, no run 141 kph, full on off, Morgan watches the ball onto his bat and defends. They'll look at playing Starc out
Starc to Morgan, no run wow, terrific yorker. On middle and leg, tailing back in ever so late. Morgan gets his bat down on it just in time and jams it out

Starc to Morgan, no run 124 kph, the slower bouncer or the ball just didn't travel after pitching? On middle and leg, the short delivery. Morgan watches it onto his bat, always wanted to play Starc out
Hazlewood to Root, no run 136 kph, full delivery outside off, driven to short cover. A hint of inward movement

Hazlewood to Root, OUT 135 kph, the first today but may not be the last. Root chops on. Was just saying Root is so good at finding gaps, and his natural instinct of trying to do so kicks in. It's a good length delivery outside off that seams back in, with Hazlewood's natural angle. The safer shot would have been playing with a full face, but Root tries
Hazlewood to Buttler, no run another indicator of how slow this surface is, 141 kph outside off, hardly gets up, Buttler sways
Hazlewood to Buttler, no run full on middle and leg, 136 kph, driven to mid-on
Hazlewood to Buttler, no run full delivery outside off, defended into the point region.
Hazlewood to Buttler, 1 run Buttler spoils the wicket maiden with a jammed drive into the gap at extra cover
Starc to Buttler, 1 run full delivery outside off from around the wicket, hit to deep cover. Looking for that off stump, or the one that got Buttler at the Gabba
Starc to Morgan, no run good length delivery around off, defended watchfully
Starc to Morgan, no run full delivery outside off, driven into the mid-off region.
Starc to Morgan, no run 141 kph, short delivery, clever change in length, well directed too, Morgan sways away
Starc to Morgan, no run seams back in, 143 kph, on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket.

Starc to Morgan, no run short around off, 142 kph, gets on top of the bounce so easily to bunt it away. Have to use the bouncer sparingly and to earn yourself a dot on a surface like this, the fuller ones are the wicket-takers
Hazlewood to Buttler, no run good stop by Mitch Marsh. Full outside off, Buttler gets forward and drives to short cover's right. Marsh dives to his right
Hazlewood to Buttler, FOUR runs he hits it harder and better and Marsh can't stop this. Overpitched outside off, drilled through wide mid-off. Marsh dives to his right
Hazlewood to Buttler, 1 run dug in, short around middle and leg, a top edge on the pull to fine leg, lands well in front
Hazlewood to Morgan, 2 runs overpitched outside off, Morgan is a tad early through his drive, past cover for a couple.
Hazlewood to Morgan, no run full and wide outside off, left alone, 139 kph
Hazlewood to Morgan, no run shortish delivery outside off, punched to that short point fielder
Stoinis to Buttler, no run 134 kph, tapped into the point region, just have to keep it there on this surface
Stoinis to Buttler, no run 129 kph, full delivery outside off, hit to the mid-off fielder. Slightly wide of him, to his left
Stoinis to Buttler, no run good length around off, 131 kph, skewed off the inside half to midwicket.
Stoinis to Buttler, 1 run 129 kph, worked away off his hips to deep square leg for a single
Stoinis to Morgan, 1 run full delivery outside off, a thick outside edge down to third man, 133 kph
Stoinis to Buttler, no run 130 kph, very good over, not too pacey but accurate, around off, coming back in, defended back with the full face
Zampa to Morgan, 1 run 85 kph, Morgan gets low for a fine paddle sweep to short fine leg
Zampa to Buttler, 2 runs very good at these shots, flat on middle and off, reverse-swept away through backward point
Zampa to Buttler, 1 run 93 kph, pushed through, Buttler plays with the full face, can often mistake the flipper for a short delivery, pushed to long-off
Zampa to Morgan, 1 run slower but short, pushed to long-on for a single
Zampa to Buttler, 1 run some flight outside off, 83 kph, the swatty drive to long-off. Reached out for it.

Zampa to Morgan, 1 run dropped by Steven Smith. Not easy but Smith will be disappointed. Short on middle and leg, pushed through. Slides on. Pulled to midwicket, where Smith gets low to his left, the ball pops out possibly off the wrists. Big moment in the game
Stoinis to Morgan, no run lots of edges on this surface. Full delivery outside off, Morgan closes his bat face too early, a thick leading edge falls well short of mid-off
Stoinis to Morgan, 1 run worked away off his hips to deep square leg
Stoinis to Buttler, no run 131 kph, Smith makes up one run, good length outside off, sliced off the open face to point where Smith dives to his right

Stoinis to Buttler, no run juuuust short of mid-off. A lot happening here. Full and wide outside off, Buttler wants to go over mid-off but the ball lobs towards the fielder off the inside half. Lands in front

Stoinis to Buttler, SIX runs he has had enough of plodding about. Full and straight, Buttler goes through with his lofted drive, not great timing but his muscle does the rest, over mid-on. Lands on the boundary cushion.
Stoinis to Buttler, 1 run shortish and wide outside off, carved away to the sweeper cover. Warner is very quick on the ball
Zampa to Buttler, 2 runs tossed up outside off, 87 kph, drilled through cover, lets his hands through the line. Two to deep cover
Zampa to Buttler, no run a flatter trajectory, on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
Zampa to Buttler, 1 run lots of flight outside off, driven to long-off with the spin.
Zampa to Morgan, 2 runs drops short does Zampa, Morgan was waiting for it, goes back and pulls over midwicket. Cummins runs around from deep midwicket to cut off the boundary
Zampa to Morgan, 1 run short and wide outside off, slashed to point
Zampa to Buttler, 1 run 87 kph, flight and straight, driven to long-off
Stoinis to Buttler, 1 run shortish delivery around off, 128 kph, worked away down to fine leg
Stoinis to Morgan, SIX runs big from Morgan. Stoinis sees Morgan coming so he shortens the length, Morgan swats it away, gets amazing timing and waaay over square leg. Sensational hit
Stoinis to Morgan, no run good length around off, defended to cover
Stoinis to Morgan, 1 run on the pads, nudged away to deep square leg for a single.
Stoinis to Buttler, no run walks down again, shortish delivery outside off, pushed to cover
Stoinis to Buttler, 1 run timed away beautifully, short around off, Buttler crashes a pull to deep square leg on the bounce
Starc to Buttler, 1 run on a length around off from Starc, played in front of point for one.
Starc to Morgan, no run good length delivery outside off, 138 kph, outside-halved to point. Steven Smith gets across to his right
Starc to Morgan, no run 140 kph, good length around off, defended to cover
Starc to Morgan, 2 runs goes full, 141 kph, around off, driven to deep cover for a couple. Opened the bat face late to find the gap
Starc to Morgan, 1 run a low full toss around off, driven to the sweeper cover. Not quite found his consistency, but that isn't entirely unexpected with Starc's pace
Starc to Buttler, no run short delivery outside off, 138 kph, Buttler sways out of the line, drops his hands and lets it go.
Cummins to Morgan, 1 run short and wide and flogged over backward point, in the air but safe, just one to the boundary rider
Cummins to Buttler, no run full, this shapes away as Buttler chases the drive, swing and a miss
Cummins to Buttler, 1 run length outside off, 138kph as Buttler drops back and opens the face for one
Cummins to Morgan, no run touch short from over the wicket, leg-stump line and Morgan can only chop down on it
Cummins to Morgan, no run banged in, sliding across and it gets big on Morgan as he shapes to pull before bailing out of the shot
Cummins to Morgan, no run dug in and jabbed off the hip to midwicket - decent return from Cummins, just two singles off it
Hazlewood to Buttler, 1 run short ball, Buttler whirls on the pull and slugs it out towards deep backward square
Hazlewood to Morgan, 1 run length, 138kph and angled across, Morgan steps out and swipes over the covers for one more
Hazlewood to Buttler, 1 run short outside off, run down to third man
Hazlewood to Morgan, no run good length, 125kph on off, taking the pace off and Morgan tinkles a straight drive fine of mid-off, decides not to take on the quick single
Hazlewood to Morgan, no run banged in, slightly short and wide, Morgan swats a cut off the toe of the bat, rolls to cover

Hazlewood to Morgan, 3 runs full, he steps into the drive, eased through the covers and this is well placed, Warner has to make up a lot of ground but he does well out on the boundary to dive and slap the ball back in and save a run
Cummins to Morgan, 1 run round the wicket, dug in short and Morgan gets into an awkward position pulling, played down through midwicket safely in the end
Cummins to Buttler, 1 run Buttler makes an early moves across on off, 137kph on a length and dabbed down, Morgan has to get his skates on but would have been home
Cummins to Morgan, no run length around off stump, solid forward defensive
Cummins to Morgan, 1 run fired in at Morgan from round the wicket, 141kph and he's up on his toes, wears it on the thigh and the ball loops wide of Paine for a leg bye
Cummins to Buttler, no run full length, 139kph and angled in, Buttler works it to midwicket
Cummins to Buttler, no run good length outside off, this touches 145kph/90mph and Buttler can only steer it straight to backward point
Hazlewood to Morgan, 1 run full, maybe a cutter on leg stump, Morgan made a little room and punches straight back past the stumps for one
Hazlewood to Buttler, no run angled in on off, 135kph and Buttler defends towards mid-on
Hazlewood to Buttler, FOUR runs Buttler advances, the ball is short in response and he's waiting in position to swing a pull away through backward square, a welcome boundary for England
Hazlewood to Buttler, 2 runs fuller, makes a bit of room to swing the blade, thick-edged behind his legs but they come haring back for two
Hazlewood to Buttler, 1 run good length in the channel, 135kph and Buttler just runs it off the face to third man

Hazlewood to Morgan, OUT gottim! Morgan tries to open the face but ends up gliding an edge to the keeper! Hazlewood makes the breakthrough, just as England were starting to look fluent again. Used the angle across Morgan, who played pretty well but is still searching for a major contribution
Cummins to Buttler, 1 run full, Buttler tucks one back down the ground to bring Moeen on strike
Cummins to Ali, no run round the wicket, back of a length and defended on off stump
Cummins to Ali, 1 run banged in short, 137kph and rising towards the throat, Moeen plays the pull pretty well and gets one to deep square leg
Cummins to Buttler, no run length, kicking off the pitch to hit the shoulder of the bat as Buttler pushes square
Cummins to Buttler, 1 run comes across and dinks one into a gap
Cummins to Ali, 1 run round the wicket, pitched full and Moeen wafts a drive, gets an inside edge for one past his pads

Marsh to Ali, 1 run dropped! A howler from Cameron White! Moeen gets a life, top-edging an ungainly heave straight up, should be a regulation catch at cover... but it goes right through him, a bar of soap in the showers, didn't get a hand on it - very similar to Hazlewood in the SCG Test, actually - and Moeen survives!
Marsh to Buttler, 1 run
Marsh to Ali, no run pitched up and driven neatly along the carpet to point
Marsh to Ali, 1 run angled across and sliced for one to third man
Marsh to Buttler, 1 wide pushes down the leg side as Buttler moves across
Marsh to Buttler, 1 wide and another, Marsh straying behind the pads, again a flick and a miss but they take the extra
Marsh to Buttler, 1 run hits a length, 133kph on middle, Buttler stuns it back past the bowler for one
Marsh to Ali, no run full and punched back to mid-off
Stoinis to Buttler, 3 runs short from Cummins, whipped away with a horizontal swing, firmly struck on the pull but again there's good work on the rope to prevent four
Stoinis to Ali, 1 wide sliding down the leg side - another to the extras column
Stoinis to Ali, no run over the wicket, comes across his stumps and blocks
Stoinis to Ali, no run length, Moeen waits and opens the face, pushes square
Stoinis to Ali, 1 run fullish around off, dug out on the drive and it dribbles through mid-off for one
Stoinis to Buttler, 1 run wicket-to-wicket, 131kph and worked off the front pad as Buttler shuffles across to find the gap at midwicket
Stoinis to Ali, 1 run pitched up and poked down the ground through mid-off

Marsh to Ali, OUT bowled him, Moeen drags on! He'll have to drag himself off, it's not been a fun tour with the bat for him... Back of a length, this time the ugly swipe goes down, rather than up, and raps the top of off stump - no chance for a fielder to mess things up and Marsh has a wicket
Marsh to Woakes, no run angled in on a length and Woakes defends
Marsh to Woakes, 1 run comes across, Woakes waits and punches one into a gap at cover
Marsh to Buttler, 1 run touch too straight and Buttler flicks it fine for one
Marsh to Woakes, 1 run full length outside off, Woakes pushes a drive past the dive of cover and they scuttle through
Marsh to Buttler, no run fired in on the stumps and Buttler breaks the wrists but this time finds midwicket

Starc to Woakes, FOUR runs full, round the wicket and looking for that wicked reverse, Woakes manages to line it up and pings the ball firmly off his pads, Stoinis makes a valiant effort on the rope but can't keep this one in play
Starc to Woakes, no run ripper, short and whistling through past the outside edge as Woakes hangs back and fences at it
Starc to Woakes, 1 run fired in, this veers late but Woakes jams the toe of the bat down and thick-edges to third man
Starc to Buttler, 2 runs pitched up and timed into a gap through cover, they hustle back
Starc to Buttler, 1 run full and straight and worked off the pad, Buttler seemed to amble the first and then the direct hit from Stoinis rebounded to cover - 200 up for England
Starc to Woakes, no run oof, beats everything, full and zipping past off stump as Woakes drops the bat
Zampa to Buttler, 1 run floated up and drilled through the off side, that is Buttler's fifty - been a vital knock for England
Zampa to Woakes, no run flighted, straightening on middle and leg, Woakes defends
Zampa to Woakes, 2 runs pushed through and Woakes steps across, pierces the off side and finds the gap for two
Zampa to Woakes, 1 run looped up full, goes down early for the paddle sweep, just gets one to short fine leg
Zampa to Buttler, 1 run spinning away outside off and Buttler guides it through the covers to the sweeper
Zampa to Woakes, 1 run tossed up and driven coming forwards, past the dive at cover and they pick up another single
Starc to Woakes, 2 runs slung down full outside off and Woakes squirts an edge past the keeper, third man prevents a boundary
Starc to Woakes, no run pitched up, 142kph on off, prodded watchfully into the covers
Starc to Woakes, no run full and straight and whipped cleanly but straight to midwicket
Starc to Woakes, no run short now, slightly wobbly seam, Woakes swipes at the ball but fails to connect

Starc to Woakes, FOUR runs blammo, timed over cover for four! Super shot from Woakes, who just sits back and opens the face on a drive, no chance for White patrolling inside the ring and it races away
Starc to Woakes, 1 run full toss to finish, nearly surprises the batsman but he bunts one through mid-on
Zampa to Buttler, 1 run flighted, the googly this time and Buttler just waits on it, dabbed towards short third man and they scurry through
Zampa to Woakes, no run does him with the Bosie, but it's a fraction wide of the stumps! Woakes aims the booming drive but misses completely, a la Bairstow earlier
Zampa to Woakes, 1 run goes back outside off and runs one behind square
Zampa to Buttler, 1 run tossed up on the stumps and nurdled into a gap
Zampa to Woakes, 2 runs touch short and Woakes backs away to hack a couple more over covers - no boundaries but another decent over of accumulation
Hazlewood to Buttler, 1 leg bye Buttler walks out and is hit on the thigh as Hazlewood shortens his length, they pinch a leg bye anyway
Hazlewood to Woakes, 1 run fuller outside off, Woakes throws the hands and thick-edges past his stumps
Hazlewood to Buttler, 1 run short and he swivels on a flat pull out to deep midwicket
Hazlewood to Woakes, 1 leg bye length ball, 138kph but drifting leg side, deflected off the pads for one more
Hazlewood to Buttler, 1 run Buttler does a little two-step at the crease, Hazlewood isn't falling for it, hits a length and he can only punch another single through point
Hazlewood to Woakes, 2 runs sliding in with the arm, flipped in the air through midwicket and they have time to run a second
Cummins to Buttler, FOUR runs oh, foxy stuff from Buttler, he waltzes across and brings out the ice cream scoop, flicked straight over the keeper away!
Cummins to Buttler, no run slower ball, good length on off, Buttler taps it down
Cummins to Buttler, no run another cutter, taking the pace off as Buttler walks into line, tries a little short-arm flick but misses
Cummins to Buttler, 1 wide another one for the wides column as Cummins pushes it down the leg side
Cummins to Buttler, 1 run full and straight and clipped through midwicket
Cummins to Woakes, no run good length, 143kph and seaming a touch, Woakes gets a leading edge short into the covers
Cummins to Woakes, FOUR runs oh, that's smoothly done, just a loft down the ground and it bounces for four! Touch full from Cummins, sweetly timed
Hazlewood to Buttler, no run dabbed down on the off side
Hazlewood to Buttler, 1 run full, he saunters across and flicks through square leg, one to the sweeper

Hazlewood to Woakes, no run length, 136kph/84mph outside off and it creeps through a touch low, Woakes jabs it into the leg side and Buttler wanted one, has to turn sharpish and scoot back to his ground
Hazlewood to Woakes, 1 run shorter, this leaps at Woakes like an eager cocker spaniel, jabbed away off the bat handle for one

Hazlewood to Buttler, no run shortish, deflected behind point via bat and pad, Woakes wanted it this time but Buttler wasn't coming... and Smith misses with a straightforward shy at the non-striker's end!
Hazlewood to Buttler, SIX runs maximum pain exacted moments later, Buttler creaming a flat six over long-off! The beast raises an eyebrow and bares its teeth
Cummins to Woakes, SIX runs short ball, slugged over the ropes at deep square leg! Woakes connects with a meaty pull and it sails for six, bringing up the England 250 in the process
Cummins to Woakes, 1 run short again but taking the pace off, he hops across and paddles this for one
Cummins to Buttler, no run Buttler backs away, another slower-bouncer from Cummins, following the batsman as he swipes and misses
Cummins to Buttler, 2 runs super placement, makes room and opens the face on a squirted drive through backward point, they get a couple as Stoinis puts in the dive on the rope
Cummins to Buttler, 1 run banged in and hammered on the pull, sweet as a nut, smooth like tropicana - but straight to deep midwicket on the bounce
Cummins to Woakes, no run short, another cutter, I think, flicks Woakes' bottom edge on the pull but bounces in front of Paine
Starc to Buttler, no run excellent start, fires in the yorker from round the wicket, Buttler can only jam it to backward point
Starc to Buttler, 2 runs dropped! Starc follows Buttler as he makes room, scooped off a length straight down the ground towards long-on... but Zampa grasses a difficult chance running in!
Starc to Buttler, no run short, taking the pace off cleverly again, Buttler can't connect
Starc to Buttler, FOUR runs another slower bouncer but Buttler connects with this one, boomed on the pull through square leg and the sweeper can't get to it despite a full-length dive
Starc to Buttler, FOUR runs oh, shot - the topspin forehand down the ground! Not quite the yorker and somehow Buttler gets under it and smashes four over mid-off with those graphite wrists!
Starc to Buttler, no run good riposte, speared full outside leg stump as Buttler backs away and fails to connect
Cummins to Woakes, 1 run length ball, Woakes clears the front leg but hammers a pull to deep midwicket

Cummins to Buttler, no run short ball, Buttler wants to ramp it but only toe-ends wide of the keeper... and there's a mix-up in the middle, both batsmen at the same end briefly, but Paine is unlucky in that his throw hits Buttler diving for his ground and it deflects to safety as Woakes scuttles back
Cummins to Buttler, 1 wide slams in the bouncer but Buttler thinks it's high and ignores it - and gets the wide
Cummins to Buttler, SIX runs smoked into the boundary boards, a fierce, flat pull and it goes all the way!
Cummins to Buttler, SIX runs clubbed straight down the ground for six more! Humpty from Buttler, he dumps a full ball into the crowd - and he's into the 90s!
Cummins to Buttler, FOUR runs short ball, sits up to pull, this time Buttler arrows a jab into the gap at cow corner... he's now just four away from a remarkable ton!
Cummins to Buttler, (no ball) 1 run full toss from Cummins, flubbed into the leg side... but it's a no-ball on height!
Cummins to Woakes, FOUR runs and Woakes manages to skim it fine for four more! Cummins' figures take a beating, he strayed down the leg side and it skipped away from Paine for another boundary

Starc to Buttler, no run full and straight, goes for the reverse sweep... Australia appeal for lbw, and up goes Chris Gaffaney's finger! Buttler reviews straight away, however, and it looks like he hit it. Yes, quite a clear edge, then on to the front pad
Starc to Buttler, 1 run full on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
Starc to Woakes, FOUR runs Woakes gets this away, superbly placed, just a flick of the wrists and it's into the gap at cow corner!
Starc to Woakes, SIX runs banged in... and clobbered over the rope at deep backward square! Top-edged on the pull but there was no one out there and the six brings Woakes his fifty!
Starc to Woakes, 1 run yes, he will, Woakes digs out a yorker towards backward point, England raise 300 and Buttler gets his chance

Starc to Buttler, 2 runs goes full and straight, Buttler can't really get under the ball but he forces it past midwicket... they are coming back for two, Buttler raises his century from the last ball of the innnings! He leaps in jubilation as he completes the second, helmet off to salute the crowd! This has been a brilliant one-day innings from Buttler,

6.20pm: Lummy, what a finish that was! England added 102 from the last ten overs, Buttler and Woakes batting together throughout as all of the hard work put in by Australia's attack in the first four-fifths of the innings was undermined... Buttler went to his fifty from 52 balls in the 41st over, and only needed another 31 to double up. We know he's capable of
6.35pm A quick turnaround. Mark Wood to bowl. Finch and Warner.
Wood to Finch, no run good length on middle and leg, 142 kph, pushed towards midwicket
Wood to Finch, 4 leg byes poor delivery. Strays down leg, off the thigh pad and past the keeper. Four leg byes to fine leg. All free runs for Australia.
Wood to Finch, no run lovely channel, just around off, 145.4 kph, played to midwicket, that strong bottom hand was evident
Wood to Finch, no run full, a yorker around off, jammed out to cover
Wood to Finch, no run 146 kph, full delivery outside off, Finch stays back, should have been forward, toe-ended back up the pitch
Wood to Finch, 3 runs lovely shot, back of a length outside off, Finch stays back and just punches a sliced push through cover point. Pulled inside just inside by a diving Morgan
Woakes to Finch, no run good length delivery outside off, blocked back
Woakes to Finch, FOUR runs beautifully played. Slightly short, and he loves them there. Just swivels on a pull and finds the gap behind square for four.
Woakes to Finch, no run pushes it slightly fuller outside off, seams back in and goes through Finch's cut. Through to the keeper
Woakes to Finch, 1 run good length outside off, 136 kph, Finch opens the bat face and carves a glide to third man

Woakes to Warner, OUT tries to force the ball through cover, but his balance was terrible. And all he can do is chip his wicket away to extra cover. Was around full, on a length. Warner stayed back to a ball he should have been forward to. Instead of adjusting his shot, he goes through with what he wanted to play, a forceful punch from the back foot, but
Woakes to White, 1 run good length delivery on middle, a 138 kph, thick inside edge to fine leg

Wood to White, no run dug in, short around off, defended back. Wood sprawls over, head first into the surface. Lovely day to go head first into a deep pool, but an unpleasant experience on a cricket field
Wood to White, no run shortish outside off, punched off the back foot to point
Wood to White, no run tidy channel, around off, blocked
Wood to White, no run 142 kph, shortish again, think Wood is getting slightly carried away with that length. Not quite the surface to do this, short around off, pulled to square leg
Wood to White, 1 wide attempts it again, a bouncer outside off, but deemed too high for legality
Wood to White, no run full delivery outside off, played to cover
Wood to White, 1 run shortish down leg, clipped into the leg side
Woakes to White, no run good length delivery outside off, played into the point region from the crease

Woakes to White, FOUR runs drifts on the pads and White picks him off through midwicket for three. Nicely played, just let the ball come to him before working the ball away. Hales picks up near the boundary, and throws the ball back but a shoe is in contact with the boundary.
Woakes to White, no run full delivery outside off, may have kept a tad low, played away towards point

Woakes to White, no run this one bounces extra, 132 kph, good length on middle and leg, some extra climb hits the splice of the bat. Toe-end and now splice off consecutive balls, of very similar lengths. In fact, this one was marginally fuller than the previous one
Woakes to White, no run full outside off, driven into the cover region
Woakes to White, 1 run a slower delivery outside off, 120 kph, tapped behind point with soft hands for a quality single. Well run
Wood to White, no run good length outside off, the ball seams back in, pushed back to the bowler
Wood to White, no run goes fuller, 136 kph, White was early through his flick off the leading edge towards cover
Wood to White, no run 138 kph, full delivery outside off, the right length for this pitch, played defensively to point. White taking his time early
Wood to White, FOUR runs smashed! A half-volley outside off at 141 kph, but White creates even more power with an expansive drive through cover. Delectable
Wood to White, 1 run 142 kph, on middle and leg, worked away towards midwicket. A hand on it from the fielder takes some pace off the ball
Wood to Finch, no run nice end, 141 kph, tidy around off, defended back
Woakes to White, no run back of a length outside off, 132 kph, came on slower than White expected, defended back

Woakes to White, FOUR runs beautiful batting. Slightly overpitched from Woakes, White gets underneath the length early and lofts the ball over cover. A very T20 stroke, but works very well in ODIs too
Woakes to White, no run good length outside off, chopped away to point
Woakes to White, 1 run 135 kph, on a length, down leg, nudged to deep square leg
Woakes to Finch, 1 run a slower delivery on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on for one. Good single, Billings the sub fielder there. Not sure who he is on for
Woakes to White, no run well bowled, 136 kph, full on middle and leg, but not overpitched. Skews off the outside half to cover
Wood to Finch, 1 leg bye 142 kph, strays on the pads, Finch gets hit on it as he misses a flick, one to square leg
Wood to White, no run full on middle and leg, 141 kph, pushed to midwicket

Wood to White, OUT edged and gone! A start for White but he perishes looking to force the ball through point. May have been done in by some extra bounce. Back of a length delivery outside off, White looks to hit the ball through point but all he can get is a thin outside edge. Was actually looking quite solid on a tricky surface
Wood to Smith, no run short and wide outside off, 145 kph, hit to point from the back foot
Wood to Smith, no run driven to mid-on from the crease
Wood to Smith, no run full delivery outside off, driven into the cover region
Plunkett to Finch, 1 run full and wide outside off, a thick under-edge to third man. Wanted to go over mid-off. Left nothing in the tank
Plunkett to Smith, 1 run shortish delivery around off, Smith walks across and nudges to square leg for one
Plunkett to Finch, no run full and wide again, shaping away, hit to short cover from the crease. The fielder dives to his right, and parries it away
Plunkett to Finch, 2 runs nudged away behind square for a couple more. Just a bit straight there from Plunkett
Plunkett to Finch, 1 run on the pads, nudged to deep square leg
Plunkett to Smith, no run Smith tries to drag a flick from well outside off to square leg, but tickles it onto his body instead
Ali to Finch, 1 run some flight outside off, driven away to long-on
Ali to Smith, 1 run slightly short around middle and leg, Smith goes back and punches to long-on from the back foot, a bit of tuen
Ali to Finch, no run gives himself some room and slashes a cut to point
Ali to Finch, SIX runs Ali keeps it on middle and leg, and that's right in Finch's wheelhouse, stays low and slog-sweeps the ball over midwicket for six. All power
Ali to Finch, no run slower on middle and leg, Finch pushes to cover. Wanted to go through cover again
Ali to Finch, 1 run shortish down leg, 89 kph, pulled to deep midwicket for one
Plunkett to Finch, no run overpitched there from Plunkett, driven to cover. Hardly any feet movement
Plunkett to Finch, 1 run 131 kph, on the pads, nudged down to fine leg
Root to Smith, 1 run short around off, worked to deep square leg for a single
Root to Finch, no run lots of flight down leg, worked away to midwicket
Root to Finch, 1 run quick, on middle and leg, nudged to deep midwicket
Root to Smith, no run lots of flight on middle and leg, 81 kph, flipped away to midwicket
Ali to Finch, 1 run looks to open up that off side again, shortish on middle, chopped to the sweeper cover
Ali to Smith, no run great stop, flat and straight, pushed to Roy at midwicket, who dives to his left, and clutches his shoulder after the fact
Ali to Smith, no run flat and straight, nudged to midwicket
Ali to Smith, 1 run shortish and wide, punched to the deep point fielder
Ali to Finch, 1 run on the pads, and Finch works him away for a run to deep square leg
Ali to Smith, 1 run pushed through, very quick, on middle and leg, whipped to deep midwicket. Tidy from Mo
Root to Smith, 1 run on the pads, nudged away to deep midwicket.
Root to Finch, no run shortish and wide, scythed away into the point region
Root to Finch, no run worked away towards midwicket

Root to Finch, 3 runs flat and quick down leg, Finch looks for a hard sweep, but can only get a bit of bat on it. The ball races down to the fine leg boundary, pulled up just inside the boundary by Bairstow, fantastic stop
Root to Smith, 1 run flicked away to deep midwicket. Some riskless runs
Root to Finch, no run short down leg, Finch has backed away quite a bit, chopped to point
Ali to Smith, 3 runs drifts on the pads, Smith just tickles him fine, aware that the fine leg fielder is very square. Three to fine leg

Ali to Finch, 1 run what was Finch doing there? He should have ran two. Full outside off, Finch stays in his crease and mis-times a lofted drive over mid-off. Doesn't move for quite a bit, plonks over mid-off.
Ali to Smith, 1 run short on the pads, worked away to deep square leg
Ali to Finch, no run flat and straight, cut off the stumps towards short third man
Ali to Finch, 1 run a low full toss, 102 kph, punched to mid-off for one.
Ali to Smith, no run some flight outside off, 90 kph, nudged to midwicket
Root to Finch, 1 run lots of flight, on the pads, worked in the gap at square leg
Root to Smith, no run flat and quick, nudged to square leg
Root to Smith, 1 run too full from Root, whipped away to deep midwicket

Root to Finch, FOUR runs whoopsy. On the pads, Finch works the ball over midwicket, a chip shot. Over midwicket. Woakes runs around from long-on, looking to flick the ball to the square leg fielder. But he over-runs it and allows the ball go to the boundary. Not a happy afternoon for him to come
Root to Finch, 1 run swept away to fine leg. A fumble by Billings, but no damage done
Root to Smith, no run pushed through, on middle and leg, nudged to square leg
Rashid to Finch, 1 run floated up full on the stumps and Finch sweeps him behind square for one
Rashid to Smith, no run touch short, Smith throws the hands through a cut but sends it to point, he's disappointed with himself for missing out
Rashid to Smith, no run pushes this out the front of the hand, skids on as Smith goes back and swipes it away
Rashid to Smith, 1 run flat, not much turn and it's helped into the leg side to the boundary rider for one
Rashid to Finch, 1 run flighted, the legbreak straightens on middle and leg, Finch gets down and paddles one more to deep square leg
Rashid to Smith, 1 run dragged down a touch leg side and Smith nurdles one off his pad to short fine leg
Root to Smith, 1 run pushed through with the arm and worked across the line
Root to Finch, 1 run tossed up, Finch chips through midwicket, nice catchable height but it's square of the fielder
Root to Smith, no run flat on the stumps and nudged to mid-on
Root to Smith, 1 run floats this up and bit more and Smith whips one out to deep midwicket
Root to Finch, no run darted on the stumps, Finch drops back but muscles a cut to the man at cover
Root to Finch, FOUR runs boshed, he gets this one through! A rump-steak smash past cover this time, red-blooded and into the unguarded acres for four
Rashid to Smith, 1 run looped up nice and slow, Smith pokes into the off side for one
Rashid to Finch, 1 run full and flighted, Finch is down early to sweep flat through square leg
Rashid to Smith, no run slips in the wrong'un now, spinning in as Smith goes back and punches to cover
Rashid to Smith, no run tossed up and Smith cuts in front of square, he wants one but Finch is less keen and Woakes swoops to keep them honest
Rashid to Smith, 1 run pushed through flat, driven playing back and Root misfields at extra cover to give them one

Rashid to Finch, no run goes up for lbw, this skidding on into the front pad as Finch went to sweep... outside the line, maybe? Or perhaps he got something on it, as England don't contemplate the review
Root to Smith, 1 run floated up and flicked in the air past square leg
Root to Finch, SIX runs here he goes, steps out and clubs over long-on, a hefty swipe and that clears long-on, bringing Finch his half-century!
Root to Finch, SIX runs and again, another Dorothy, plants the front foot and mows the ball over cow, a flat smear that is caught - just - by a policeman sitting guarding the boundary from intruders!
Root to Finch, 1 run darted in and Finch settles for nudging this away to the leg side
Root to Smith, 1 run lobbed down on middle and leg, Smith works the single
Root to Finch, 1 run flat, no turn and nudged through midwicket

Rashid to Finch, OUT tosses up the legbreak, Finch goes to sweep, hit on the pads - and given! Finch immediately signals for a review, seeming to suggest he got some bat on it... but there's no bottom edge on the replays, and Hawk-Eye has it clipping leg stump! It was very close to sliding by but umpire's call is all England needed. Huge wicket, no hund
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run floated up and Marsh pokes into a gap to get off the mark first ball
Rashid to Smith, 1 run flighted outside off and Smith swings hard through a drive to the covers sweeper
Rashid to Marsh, no run slows the pace up, gets him reaching for the drive, mistimed back towards the bowler
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run pushed through outside off and Marsh guides one wide of slip
Rashid to Smith, 1 run tossed up full on off, Smith punches to the right of cover
Root to Smith, no run tossed up on middle and leg, prodded towards mid-on
Root to Smith, 2 runs sliding in and worked off the pads, Smith goes back and gets this into a gap for a couple
Root to Smith, 1 run flat, worked with the (marginal) turn to midwicket
Root to Marsh, no run tossed up and jabbed towards point from the crease
Root to Marsh, 2 runs flat offbreak, steered for a couple through the covers as Marsh opens the face
Root to Marsh, 1 run lobbed up on the stumps, tickled down the ground
Rashid to Marsh, no run floated up full, driven back to the bowler, Rashid sticks out a paw
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run flighted, goes back and works through square leg
Rashid to Smith, no run pushed through, nudged to midwicket
Rashid to Smith, no run pushed through on the stumps and Smith can't get this away into the covers
Rashid to Smith, 1 run floated up and Smith tips and runs into the covers this time, taking cover as the throw comes in... but he was well home
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run floated up full on off, Marsh taps another single down the ground to long-off
Root to Marsh, FOUR runs there's no Finch but Marsh knows how to give it some tap, too, rocking back to power a drive in front of the deep cover sweeper
Root to Marsh, no run darted in on the pads, tucked to the leg side
Root to Marsh, no run fired in again and worked to midwicket
Root to Marsh, no run floated up, Marsh attempts to drive and it comes off the inside half of the bat to mid-on
Root to Marsh, 2 runs drifts a little wide of the stumps with his line and Marsh neatly steers a couple behind point
Root to Marsh, FOUR runs dragged down and Marsh collars him again, roundhousing a pull past the man at deep square leg... Root grabs his cap and curses in frustration
Rashid to Smith, 1 run tossed up and poked into a gap on the off side
Rashid to Marsh, no run gives this some air, Marsh leans out and strokes the ball to extra cover
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run flatter, drops back and crunches past the fielder on the drive, there's a sweeper out there
Rashid to Smith, no run full and flighted and miscued back towards the bowler coming across
Rashid to Smith, 1 run tossed up, Smith spots the googly and flicks it away off his pads behind square

Rashid to Marsh, 2 runs drops a touch short and Marsh has width to throw the hands, crashed out towards deep extra cover but Woakes does terrific work to prevent four, diving full length to drag it in
Woakes to Smith, 1 run full outside off, Smith crunches a drive through the off side for one
Woakes to Marsh, no run shortens his length, maybe a cutter and it dies under Marsh's attempt to pull
Woakes to Marsh, no run length, 123kph/75mph outside off, dabbed towards backward point
Woakes to Marsh, no run tight lines, over the top of off, Marsh blocks it back to the bowler
Woakes to Marsh, 2 runs takes the pace off, cutter wide of the stumps but Marsh is in position to steers behind point, Wood slides along the rope to prevent four
Woakes to Marsh, no run closer to off stump, driven to mid-off without timing
Ali to Smith, 1 run angled in on the stumps and Smith works across the line
Ali to Marsh, no run flat offbreak, driven firmly off the back foot but Moeen flings himself across and gets a hand on it
Ali to Marsh, 1 run fired into the pitch, not much turn and Marsh forces one more down the ground
Ali to Smith, no run tossed up on off, Smith comes across and nudges to midwicket

Ali to Smith, 1 run touch short, spinning down the leg side as Smith goes back and flicks past Buttler, just a tickle of inside edge on it and Rashid has to scurry across from short fine leg to prevent it running away
Ali to Marsh, 1 run pushed through flat outside off stump and this is cut through point for one
Woakes to Marsh, no run back of a length outside off, stabbed square
Woakes to Marsh, no run fullish, Marsh steps across to drive, Woake fields in his follow through
Woakes to Marsh, 1 run slower ball, in the channel and Marsh throws the hands, thick-edged down to third man where Wood cuts it off
Woakes to Smith, 1 run length delivery, another cutter, Smith squirts it to third man along the carpet
Woakes to Marsh, no run pitched up, 135kph on off stump, Marsh drills it to mid-on
Woakes to Marsh, 1 run in the channel and taking the pace off again, Marsh swats one more through the covers - just three singles off the over
Ali to Marsh, 1 run pushed through outside off, Marsh slides one off the outside edge
Ali to Smith, no run angled in and tapped to the leg side
Ali to Smith, 1 run flat, on the stumps, Smith waits and works the ball off his hip
Ali to Marsh, no run tosses up the tempter and Marsh attempts to crash it down the ground, gets a thick-bottom edge into the crease
Ali to Marsh, 1 run flat outside off and punched through point off the back foot
Ali to Smith, 2 runs darted in the channel and Smith opens the face to steer the ball squarer, gets a couple this time
Root to Marsh, 1 run pushed through flat and chopped off the back foot to the covers sweeper
Root to Smith, 1 run dobbed on the stumps, slightly short and worked off the hip through square leg
Root to Marsh, 1 run floated up full on off stump and Marsh checks a drive down to long-off
Root to Smith, 1 run tossed up and Smith heaves across the line, firmly swept but picks out deep square leg
Root to Marsh, no run angled in flat and Marsh prods to midwicket
Root to Marsh, no run slows up his pace and Marsh can only push a drive to extra cover - so Root sneaks through a cheap one
Ali to Smith, no run Moeen pushes the ball flat on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
Ali to Smith, no run flighted, gets him coming forward to drive but Smith picks out cover
Ali to Smith, 1 run flat on the stumps, whipped away through midwicket off the back foot
Ali to Marsh, 3 byes tossed up and this spins, inside the bat as Marsh swings hard and misses, it clears the stumps and beats Buttler, too, running away for byes
Ali to Smith, 1 run fired in on the stumps and Smith smears the ball past midwicket, still only one into the deep
Ali to Marsh, 1 run floated up outside off and Marsh punches another single in front of square
Root to Marsh, 1 run pushed through flat outside off and steered into the deep
Root to Smith, no run darted down in the channel and this time Smith pokes to cover
Root to Smith, 1 run flighted, comes across on off and whips behind square
Root to Marsh, 1 run flat delivery, leg-stump line and Marsh works one out to deep square leg
Root to Smith, no run tossed up, much slower and Smith mistimes a cut to cover
Root to Smith, no run quicker ball and Smith drops back and chops into the ground from in front of his stumps, Root scampers after it and finishes with another dot
Ali to Marsh, 2 runs Moeen continues to wheel away, spinning in on off but well played off the back foot past backward point for a couple
Ali to Marsh, no run tossed up and mistimed on the drive into the covers
Ali to Marsh, 1 run flat delivery on middle and leg, clipped through square from back in the crease

Ali to Smith, FOUR runs Smith finds the boundary! Tossed up and he sweeps powerfully in front of square, right out of the middle and it beats the boundary rider... Gets his first four, from his 63rd ball
Ali to Smith, 1 run flat on the stumps and chopped down the ground to long-on
Ali to Marsh, 1 run pushed through, Marsh sits back and swats a cut out to the sweeper
Wood to Marsh, 2 runs full length, Marsh steps out and crashes past cover, in front of the sweeper for a couple
Wood to Marsh, no run tight line, this time he punches to the man on the ring
Wood to Marsh, no run length outside off, 135kph and driven square from the crease, picks out the fielder
Wood to Marsh, 1 run fuller and straighter and worked through mid-on
Wood to Smith, no run good pace, 140kph in the channel and Smith flirts with the outside edge as he drives and misses

Wood to Smith, OUT throws the hands, thick edge and Buttler snaffles a terrific low grab! Wood is delirious as he charges off...but Smith isn't walking. This is going to the TV umpire, and the soft signal is out, which could be crucial. Has he got fingertips under it? This is going to be incredibly tight, it's a fantastic effort from Buttler, but is the
Rashid to Marsh, no run yorker around off, jammed away into the cover region
Rashid to Marsh, no run flight outside off, a thick outside edge down to third man.
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run nice and slow around off and middle, dabbed towards short third man
Rashid to Stoinis, no run quick on off and middle, pushed towards cover
Rashid to Stoinis, no run pushed through, full around off, driven back to the bowler
Rashid to Stoinis, 2 runs lots of flight outside off, driven past cover for a couple. Long-off cleans up
Wood to Marsh, 2 runs short and wide outside off, an iffy start, slashed towards point, who gets a good hand on it. The sweeper cover cleans up
Wood to Marsh, no run 139 kph, full around off, coming back in, defended into the cover region
Wood to Marsh, 1 wide dug in but too short, goes over the shoulder, 137 kph, wide.
Wood to Marsh, no run full delivery outside off, 138 kph, seams back in, pushed to cover

Wood to Marsh, FOUR runs fine shot. Bairstow on the sweeper cover boundary messes up, and the frustration of the crowd is vented on Bairstow. Slashed away with immense power, but it goes through Bairstow, who is a terrific fielder. Worsened by the time of day
Wood to Marsh, no run good length and straight, nudged to midwicket.
Wood to Marsh, 1 run a slower ball outside off, 127 kph, dabbed down to third man off the open face.
Rashid to Marsh, FOUR runs Marsh biffs another very powerful drive over cover for four to get to fifty. Another fine batting performance this summer
Rashid to Marsh, no run pushed through, quick on middle and leg, defended
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run slow through the air, 83 kph, on middle and off, some turn too, guided to point

Rashid to Stoinis, SIX runs that's a confident shot. And runs give you confidence. Runs down to a good wristspinner early in his innings, backs his ability, gets to the pitch and drills a drive over mid-on. All the way
Rashid to Stoinis, no run the googly on middle, 85 kph, nudged to midwicket
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run the googly, not sure he picked it, went back, his back pad right in front of off, but he got some bat on it and flicked to midwicket, read it off the pitch
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run flat down leg, worked to deep square leg
Ali to Marsh, no run flat on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler.
Ali to Marsh, 1 run keeps a tad low, flat around off, pushed away towards cover from the back foot. Almost crept underneath the bat
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run flight outside off, driven towards wide long-off for a run. Bairstow quick on the ball to prevent two
Ali to Marsh, 1 run flight outside off, driven to long-off, 92 kph
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run flat outside off, reverse-swept, or paddle reverse-swept down to short third man
Rashid to Stoinis, no run lovely loopy legbreak outside off, short outside off, rips away and beats the bat
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run the googly on middle and leg, nudged to square leg

Rashid to Marsh, OUT taken at long-on. And Australia stumble further. This is a huge moment, the set man has picked out long-on. There have been so many dismissals where a batsman mistakes a flat legspinner for a long-hop. Happened to Guptill against Zampa at this ground, think it was last year. Marsh goes back and looks to pull over midwicket, but the
Rashid to Paine, no run flat outside off, the legbreak, skews to point
Rashid to Paine, no run lots of flight on that around off, driven back to the bowler
Rashid to Paine, no run 85 kph, slow outside off, pushed towards cover from the crease
Woakes to Stoinis, no run good length on middle and leg, worked away to midwicket
Woakes to Stoinis, 1 run another slower ball, on middle and leg, nudged to fine leg for one
Woakes to Paine, 1 run a short delivery around off, Paine gets nicely on top of the bounce and pulls to deep square leg
Woakes to Stoinis, no run a slower delivery, 120 kph, around off, pushed to cover
Woakes to Stoinis, 1 run good length on off, 135 kph, off the outside half towards cover
Woakes to Paine, no run a slower delivery on middle and leg, clipped to short midwicket. Tidy over from Woakes
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run luckily for Stoinis, he didn't go after it, flat delivery on off, a top-edged sweep to deep square leg, on the bounce
Ali to Paine, 1 run short down leg, pulled to deep midwicket for one.
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run flight outside off, driven to long-on for one
Ali to Paine, no run short down leg, Paine misses a routine flick, struck on the thigh pad
Ali to Paine, no run looking for the big slog sweep, but Moeen has fired this in outside off, goes past the sweep
Ali to Paine, 1 run full on middle and leg, driven to long-on
Woakes to Paine, 2 runs a slower delivery on middle, Paine is slightly quick through the pull, two down to fine leg
Woakes to Paine, 1 run full and wide outside off, driven towards mid-off for a single
Woakes to Stoinis, 1 run 120 kph, another slower delivery, nudged to midwicket for one
Woakes to Paine, 1 run a low full toss, driven away to long-on
Woakes to Stoinis, 1 run another slower delivery outside off, dabbed to point
Woakes to Paine, no run another tidy over from England, a slower delivery outside off, the ball creeps underneath the bat.
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run charges down and drives to long-on, got too close to the ball
Ali to Paine, 1 run flat down leg, following Paine, driven to long-on again
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run shortish and flat outside off, the batsman goes back and punches to the sweeper cover
Ali to Paine, FOUR runs in the gap for four. Flat down leg, Moeen follows Paine as he backs away, flicked with fierce power into the gap at square leg
Ali to Paine, no run well bowled, sees Paine backing away, fires a wide yorker, creeps underneath the bat
Ali to Paine, 1 run full and wide outside off, carved to the sweeper cover
Wood to Paine, 1 run a slower, wide delivery outside off, smashed to the sweeper cover for a run.
Wood to Stoinis, 1 run a low full toss outside off, badly-timed drive to cover
Wood to Paine, 1 run another slower delivery around off, chopped away into the midwicket region, Wood chases, picks up, turns around and misses at the bowler's end.
Wood to Stoinis, 1 run good short ball, on middle and leg, a top-edged hook to fine leg. Nowhere near control
Wood to Paine, no run comes down, sees him coming and Wood shortens the length, on off, Paine is hurried through his pull, goes past
Wood to Paine, 1 run a low full toss, 138 kph, driven to the sweeper cover for a run. Terrific over from Wood, executed pretty much what he wanted save a full toss earlier
Rashid to Paine, 1 run flat around off, 85 kph, swept to deep square leg
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run well bowled, sees Stoinis coming and Rashid shortens his length but slow outside off, Stoinis improvises a checked flick to midwicket. Good cricket
Rashid to Paine, 2 runs short around off, Paine goes right back and pulls to deep midwicket
Rashid to Paine, 1 run a googly down leg, 87 kph, pulled to deep square leg. Excellent defensive bowling
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run flat, quick and wide, driven to deep cover. Another fine over so far, can he finish well?
Rashid to Paine, no run superb from Rashid, doesn't mind some flight on middle and leg, but does mind a full length, so the length is shorter, spins and beats the sweep. Awesome over

Wood to Stoinis, FOUR runs swatted for four. A short, slower delivery outside off, pulled past mid-off, to his right. Stoinis has been in great hitting form, Australia need another big innings to keep this series alive
Wood to Stoinis, 1 run good length around off, cut to deep point, one.
Wood to Paine, 1 run a short delivery on middle and leg, 141 kph, a top-edged pull towards the man at deep square leg
Wood to Stoinis, no run terrific bowling, good length but just inside the tramline. Boos from the crowd, but definitely inside the guideline, juuust inside but inside
Wood to Stoinis, no run and again, a full and wide yorker. Stoinis has backed away, looking to open up the off side but Wood is bowling it really wide so he can't reach it. The defensive bluff
Wood to Stoinis, 1 run just eight off the over after four off the first ball, a slower ball on middle and leg, heaved to deep square leg
Rashid to Stoinis, FOUR runs power! Rashid does not want to bowl full, he is short and a tad wide, Stoinis stays back and lofts the ball intentionally over cover. Terrific batting
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 bye bye? Flight outside off, Stoinis misses a drive, the ball deflects off Buttler's gloves for one to third man
Rashid to Paine, 2 runs more flight outside off, Paine stretches and fetches, a hard sweep to deep square leg for a brace
Rashid to Paine, 1 run quick outside off, chipped away towards the sweeper cover. Just one

Rashid to Stoinis, 2 runs this is really good bowling, sees Stoinis coming and shortens the length. Stoinis can only bunt the ball towards long-on with middling timing, which allows Paine enough time to come back

Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run Stoinis charges, gets close, too close, unable to get underneath the ball, can only hit the ball to long-off. Another excellent comeback from a bowler who was hit for a boundary off his first ball

Woakes to Stoinis, SIX runs another fine start to the over, a good length delivery on middle and leg. Stoinis shuffles across, bends his knees, stays low and whips a flick into the gap behind square. His muscular power takes it over the boundary
Woakes to Stoinis, 1 run a slower ball outside off, 122 kph, hit to cover for a run with bad timing.
Woakes to Paine, 1 run full delivery around off, Paine nails a drive on the bounce to Root at mid-off. A boundary a few yards either side
Woakes to Stoinis, 2 runs a clever short slower ball around off, swatted away to long-on, two more. Good running
Woakes to Stoinis, 1 run full and wide, was there to slice backward of point, but he can only mis-time a drive to the sweeper cover
Woakes to Paine, 2 runs a low full toss around middle, hit over the bowler for a couple more. Root at mid-off, runs to his right, but can't stop two.
Wood to Stoinis, 1 run good length on middle and leg, slashed to backward point.
Wood to Paine, 1 run a slower delivery outside off, under-edged towards the keeper. Stoinis steals the strike with a good call
Wood to Stoinis, FOUR runs there's four. Full and wide outside off, Stoinis reaches out for the ball and guides the ball into the gap between point and third man for four. Fifty for Stoinis
Wood to Stoinis, 1 run good length on middle and leg, heaved away to deep square leg. Just the one.
Wood to Paine, no run a DOT BALL! Valuable. Silence at the SCG. Short delivery on middle and leg, beats Paine's pull.
Wood to Paine, 1 run full and wide outside off, beautifully drilled but straight to the sweeper cover. Fantastic end from Wood.
Woakes to Paine, 1 run a slower ball on leg, heaved to long-on. They opt to stick with one. Stoinis wants the strike.
Woakes to Stoinis, 2 runs a nice full, wide yorker outside off, jammed out to long-on. Bad enough timing to come back for two

Woakes to Stoinis, OUT and taken at deep square leg. This game's gone. A short delivery on middle and leg, the slower bouncer, forcing a tiring Stoinis to generate his own pace. He is too tired, all he can do is pull the ball to deep square leg. Billings runs in and takes a good, low catch.
Woakes to Cummins, no run there it is, a wide yorker creeps under Cummins' bat. Buttler is pumped. What an innings he played
Woakes to Cummins, 1 run a short and wide delivery, slashed to deep point

Woakes to Paine, 1 run a slower ball on off, swatted to deep square leg and England win the ODI series. Wide smiles on England's faces, Buttler knows the quality and the significance of the innings he played!

The game, on a tricky SCG pitch, was set up by the belligerence of Jos Buttler, who smashed another terrific hundred. The England bowling was disciplined and accurate, and they did what they had to in the end overs to prevent an in-form middle order from doing too much damage. An iffy moment with Steven Smith's dismissal, but England thorough and clinical agai

10.08pm This England ODI juggernaut continues to roll. They have got to be one of the best in the world currently. They have beaten a strong Australia team thrice in succession away from home. And three convincing wins. The series is done. The Tests and the ODIs one-sided, but dominated by different teams.
England won by 16 runs
Player of the match is Jos Buttler, ENG
